definition: (of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to

sentences.english: It may look like a severe sunburn, later becoming reddish Brown, rough, and scaly.
sentences.chinese: 初看似嚴重的曬斑，後呈紅褐色，粗糙並有鱗屑。

sentences.english: The symptoms of sunburn do not begin until two to four hours after the sun's damage has been done.
sentences.chinese: 曬斑的症狀在陽光損害後兩到四小時纔會顯現。

sentences.english: I have a dark sun spot that I used to have to cover with heavy duty concealer.
sentences.chinese: 我有一個曬斑，我以前都需要用很多遮瑕膏來蓋。

sentences.english: Scientists in Britain are suggesting that a tomato product may help fight sunburn and wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 英國科學家們提出西紅柿產品有助於對抗曬斑與皺紋。

sentences.english: Sunburn is due to overexposure of the skin to ultraviolet rays of the sun or a sun lamp.
sentences.chinese: 曬斑緣於皮膚對太陽中紫外線的過度暴露。

sentences.english: The technical term for sunburn is erythema.
sentences.chinese: 曬斑的專業術語是紅斑。

sentences.english: Sunburn never causes a third-degree burn or scarring.
sentences.chinese: 曬斑不會導致三度燒傷或結疤。

definition: in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
to have dark circles under one's eyes/to have eyes like a panda
